channel.title: JApplet help
channel.description:
Before you think 'wow', just read this small bit. I have made a JApplet before, the part I have not done, is one to accept a parameter in the form of this. [code=html] <PARAM NAME="skinurl" VALUE="http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/Soharuda.png"> [/code]
As well as for some reason my JApplet is not properly starting, but I believe it falls under it not having a link set, causing it to throw an error. Here is a pastebin of what I am currently working with. Yes I know some methods are not needed. I will tend to that after it works. http://pastebin.com/HG6R5rpU

item.title: JApplet help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

A bit more descriptive than the doc I was reading. I’ll bookmark that, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: JApplet help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:434845”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=537561.msg3930900#msg3930900 date=1330656554]
Why are you calling start() yourself? The applet controller will call start when it’s ready to start the applet. You also shouldn’t really be initializing anything in your constructor; that’s what init() is for.
[/quote]

I never worked with JApplets but a few times so I am not to sure how they initialize. Just trying to get this program to work.[/quote]

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/uiswing/components/applet.html

Read full topic

item.title: JApplet help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Taharok:

Why are you calling start() yourself? The applet controller will call start when it’s ready to start the applet. You also shouldn’t really be initializing anything in your constructor; that’s what init() is for.

I never worked with JApplets but a few times so I am not to sure how they initialize. Just trying to get this program to work.

Read full topic

item.title: JApplet help
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Why are you calling start() yourself? The applet controller will call start when it’s ready to start the applet. You also shouldn’t really be initializing anything in your constructor; that’s what init() is for.

item.title: JApplet help
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Before you think ‘wow’, just read this small bit. I have made a JApplet before, the part I have not done, is one to accept a parameter in the form of this.

<PARAM NAME="skinurl" VALUE="http://s3.amazonaws.com/MinecraftSkins/Soharuda.png">

As well as for some reason my JApplet is not properly starting, but I believe it falls under it not having a link set, causing it to throw an error. Here is a pastebin of what I am currently working with. Yes I know some methods are not needed. I will tend to that after it works.
http://pastebin.com/HG6R5rpU
